Sequence Information.Peptide Name: AM-CATH28 (AM-CATH36 fragment, or As-CATH4 fragtment, Synthetic AMPs, UCLL1)

Literature Information.Literature: Discovery: sequence alignment to identify the conserved cathelin domain followed by AMP mapping.Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is most similar (77.78%) toAM-CATH36k: 25%; G: 14%; I=L=R: 11%.Activity: active against A. baumannii ATCC 9955 or ATCC BAA-1794 (MIC 3.4-9.0 uM), E-faecalis ATCC 22192 or 51299 (MIC > 45 uM), E-coli ATCC 4157 (MIC >45 uM), K. pneumoniae ATCC 33495 or ATCC BAA-1705 (MIC 1.8-9.0 uM), P. aeruginosa ATCC 9027 (MIC 6.7 uM), and S-aureus ATCC 25923 or 33592 (MIC >13 uM).Structure:  random coil in water and helical in 50% TFE or SDS.Toxicity: sheep RBC: <0.5% hemolysis at 300 ug/ml, not hemo.lytic. Also not toxic to human lung epithelial cells A549 at 100 ug/ml.
Literature Information.Author: Barksdale SM, Hrifko EJ, van Hoek ML. 2017
Literature Information.Title: Cathelicidin antimicrobial peptide from Alligator mississippiensis has antibacterial activity against multi-drug resistant Acinetobacter baumanii and Klebsiella pneumoniae.
